paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the BRCA2:c.681+5G>C variant, its effects on splicing, and its association with cancer risk.

patients.demographics: Two sisters (CC and DC) and one female patient (LP), ages 29, 39, and 66 respectively.
patients.phenotype: Breast cancer in CC and LP; sigmoid adenocarcinoma in DC.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 66-yr-old female (LP) was referred to the Genetics Clinic at Hospital de Santa Maria because of the history of bilateral breast cancer.
One of the sisters (CC) was diagnosed at 29 yr with right breast cancer.
The other sister (DC) was diagnosed at 39 yr with sigmoid adenocarcinoma.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2:c.681+5G>C variant abolishes the expression of the canonical mRNA and induces the expression of at least two variant-specific splicing isoforms.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family of CC and DC.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is classified as a variant of unknown significance (VUS) in the ClinVar database.
key_quotes: This variant results from a G-to-C substitution at nucleotide +5 in intron 8.
Homozygous mutant cells expressed low levels of BRCA2 protein and were defective in DNA repair.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
